titlepage.titleproper: Inventory for the Thomas J. Rollins Papers, 1875-1997 and undated
titlepage.author: Abel Ramirez

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Thomas J. Rollins Papers, 1875-1997 and undated
did.abstract: The personal papers of Thomas J. Rollins from 1875-1997 and undated.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University

did.physdesc: 5 boxes, 1 sea chest and cushion (9 linear feet)

bioghist.head: Biographical Sketch
bioghist.p: Born July 28, 1924, Thomas (Tom) J. Rollins was a native of Whitharral, Texas, and a graduate of Texas Technological College. Rollins's family was originally from Hollis, Oklahoma, and moved to Whitharral, Texas, in 1932. During World War II, he served in the Navy for 35 months. After the war, he entered the insurance field in Lubbock, Texas, in 1948. For a while he was assistant purchasing agent at Texas Tech, then he became associated with Citizens National Life Insurance Company. The Company later merged with Central American Life in 1953. Rollins served as vice president of Central American Life Insurance Company then as president. He retired in 1993. Tom and his wife Nelda had no children. They were active in various civic and university support groups in Lubbock and Texas Tech.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains the personal papers of Tom Rollins such as correspondence, financial material, military records from his experience in the U.S. Navy during the Second World War, printed material, and family scrapbook material. Also included are some files on Grace Inez Edgar, Tom's sister, who was a teacher at Idalou (Texas) Elementary. The memorabilia items in the gold sea chest were placed within oversized shelves along with the red cushion.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged by series: business records correspondence, military records, financial material, legal material, literary production, printed material, scrapbook material, and memorabilia.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: The subject headings used by the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library are derived from the Library of Congress and/or locally developed.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Thomas J. Rollins Papers, 1875-1997 and undated, Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University, Lubbock, Texas

relatedmaterial.p: For related materials located in the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, see the following collections:
